Not "One Heretical Sentence" For Use in Teaching, Correspondence, etc.--I am now looking over my diaries and copies of letters written for several years back, commencing before I went to Europe. . . . I have the most precious matter to reproduce and place before the people in testimony form. While I am able to do this work, the people must have these things, to revive past history, that they may see that there is one straight chain of truth, 


                                      -246- 

without one heretical sentence, in that which I have written.  This, I am instructed, is to be a living letter to all in regard to my faith.--Letter 329a, 1905, pp. 1, 2. (To Granddaughter Mabel White, Nov. 16, 1905.) 

Released April 1966.
